alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 3:54PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Carbon County through 445 PM MDT... At 353 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Sinclair, or 14 miles east of Rawlins, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Carbon County. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 224 and 243. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for south central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; North Snowy Range Foothills
